DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate whether combination taste probe food-related cue induce dopamine release striatal extra-striatal brain region healthy subject .
DOC.brief_title: Striatal Extra-striatal Dopamine Release Response Food Healthy Humans
DOC.criteria: Female 20 ≤ BMI ≤ 25 Right hand Stable body weight least 3 consecutive month start study history behavioral , therapeutic surgical treatment aim lead weight loss/gain Subject understand study procedure agree participate study give write informed consent Medical ( current history ) : Abdominal/thoracic surgery except appendectomy Gastrointestinal , endocrine ( especially diabetes ) , neurological disease Cardiovascular , respiratory , renal urinary disease Hypertension Food drug allergy Head trauma loss consciousness Psychiatric disorder ( current history ) : Eating disorder Psychotic disorder Major depressive disorder Somatoform disorder Emotional and/or restraint eat Treatment last 6 month antidepressant ( MAO inhibitor ) , neuroleptic , sedative hypnotic , psychostimulants , glucocorticoid , appetite suppressant , estrogen , opiate , dopamine medication . Oral contraception allow History cannabis use drug abuse least 12 month prior study Intolerance lactose Vegetarians Smoking alcohol intake great 5 alcoholic unit per week ( one alcoholic unit = 10 gr ethanol ) More moderate exercise ( > 30 min , five time per week walk equivalent ) High caffeine intake ( > 500 ml coffee daily equivalent ) Exposure significant amount ( > 1mSv ) ionize radiation research study within last 12 month Claustrophobia much uneasiness limited space ( order tolerate confinement PET scanning procedure ) Inability unwillingness perform study procedure , subject consider unsuitable way principal investigator Recent participation ( < 30 day ) simultaneous participation another clinical trial Any condition would interfere Magnetic Resonance Imaging ( MRI ) PET study ( e.g. , cochlear implant , metal fragment eye , cardiac pacemaker , neural stimulator , metallic body inclusion metal implant body may interfere MRI scan ) Anemia Pregnancy
